file.preview: @jonathanlevi:  Thanks for your help. I'm trying to run a peer node with security enabled first time. I start membersrvc first and then node.  I've configured both core.yaml and membersrvc.yaml with cert details, but still getting below error. Here is complete details. vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0581047:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ docker run --name test_node --rm -it -e CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=unix:///var/run/docker.sock -e CORE_PEER_ID=vp0 -e CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=http://172.17.0.1:2375 -e CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true -e  CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=DEBUG -e CORE_PEER_PKI_TLS_ENABLED=true -e CORE_PEER_PKI_TLS_ROOTCERT_FILE=./bddtests/tlsca.cert -e CORE_PEER_PKI_TLS_SERVERHOSTOVERRIDE=OBC -e CORE_PEER_PKI_ECA_PADDR=172.17.0.1:2375 -e CORE_PEER_PKI_TCA_PADDR=172.17.0.1:2375 -e CORE_PEER_PKI_TLSCA_PADDR=172.17.0.1:2375 -e CORE_SECURITY_ENABLED=true -e CORE_SECURITY_PRIVACY=true -e CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLID=test_vp0 -e CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLSECRET=MwYpmSRjupbT fabric-refdata-peer:latest peer node start --pe...

comment.comment: <@U11MANG9G>:  Thanks for your help. Here are all details.

text: In order to register a new user at an ECA, is adding it to the membersrvc.yaml file (and restarting the service) the only way?
Can't I register new users programmatically?
hi <@U1ENXTQRL>, it’s possible to do it, you need to register and then enroll user. You could take a look at sdk/node/test/unit/registrar.js
you’re welcome. I found it also well documented in this section: <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/NodeSDK-setup/>

Hi, I'm getting below grpc error when i try to run a node with TLS enabled . Any idea how to fix this issue.  Error - grpc: ClientConn.resetTransport failed to create client transport: connection error: desc = "transport: x509: certificate has expired or is not yet valid"; Reconnecting to "vp0:30303"

attachments.title: Peer node is failing when security is enabled  · Issue #2254 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: Description I'm trying to start a peer node with security enabled. But getting below error - Can someone please help. vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0581047:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperl...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Peer node is failing when security is enabled  · Issue #2254 · hyperledger/fabric

text: <@U11MANG9G>:  I think the issue is with the grpc when i try to run a peer with TLS enabled

yes that is the issue but now i'm getting this error -  Error - grpc: ClientConn.resetTransport failed to create client transport: connection error: desc = "transport: x509: certificate has expired or is not yet valid"; Reconnecting to "vp0:30303"
is this a docker certificate related issue?
So I need the following info:
Can you tell me what's the docker --version?
no i dont have insecure-registry added
1. We can "hack it" first/temporarily, by asking Docker to allow insecure-regisrty
This will allow us to "bypass" the docker check, and then see if that's a `docker` issue.
2. I want to see the properties of the cert.
`certificate has expired or is not yet valid`
Whatever it is, I would like to replicate in a test and document...
ok great..for option1 what do we put as "<http://myregistrydomain.com:5000|myregistrydomain.com:5000>" ?
BTW: Is this the 'original' certificate that you received from the code?
(I mean, is this the one on git...com/hl/facric/....
(I would like to rename it from OBC... at some point). Note to self.

BTW: The docs for this are here:
<https://docs.docker.com/registry/insecure/>

attachments.title: Testing an insecure registry
attachments.text: Deploying a Registry in an insecure fashion

text: Not that you should have known it, or that I recommend it...
FWIW. This is how I learned about it.
but not sure about the parameter to pass
BTW: sorry I'm asking for so much (pre-coffee-Jonathan)
Do we have one issue, or two?
I mean, the original issue from yesterday (my timezone)
no problem Jonathan. This is really helpful.
yes that s resolved ..it was my mistake
That was fixed by editing the YAML, right?
OK, cool, thanks. Because I'm also thinking about a better error message or so and a FAQ/troubleshooting entry. That's why I'm collecting these :wink:
Thanks a lot. Will check with insecure-registry and let you know in some time
Sure, please note that you might want to restart docker or so.
p.s. We can also work on this off-line (on Slack)
sure will page you offline next time.
No, I mean, just for this instance/thread. We'll report here what we find... or we'll ask again if we get stuck.

text:
FULL DISCLOSURE: I, *too*, did *not* have *ANY* organizational/promotional discount code (HINT, HINT)... ! :wink:

But it will be great to meet some of you there. I'll wear a TCert.

Is this feasible?
Jim has an attribute secret:xxx in ACA. Bob has an attribute secret:yyy in ACA. Jim uploads some data, data is encrypted with xxx, and wrote to ledger. Bob sends some money to Jim, then Jim'data is decrypted, and encrypted with yyy. So that Bob can query the ledger to see Jim's data.
